title.romaji: Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan - Kyoto Douran

description:
The second season of Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan (2023).

A phantom of the Bakumatsu who must be taken down. All the answers you desire are in Kyoto!

(Source: Aniplex USA)

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

title.native: るろうに剣心 -明治剣客浪漫譚-
るろうに剣心 －明治剣客浪漫譚－(2023)
るろうに剣心 －明治剣客浪漫譚－ 第三期

node.description:
He once worked as an assistant for his favorite author Takeshi Obata, and is influenced by Marvel comics such as the X-Men and Spider-Man.

When Watsuki was a young boy, his brother, who was three years older, drew manga. Watsuki’s older brother was his role model so he started drawing Manga as well. Watsuki was also inspired by a variety of early Manga artists such as Osamu Tezuka and Fujiko F. Fujio. Later on, his brother stopped drawing manga but, "Because Mr. Watsuki was dumb, he kept drawing it (manga) for a while.” 

When Watsuki was in middle school, he practiced kendo. He still drew manga but also enjoyed sports. Watsuki admits that he was “so weak, in fact, that I was an embarrassment to my 183 centimeters of height." Watsuki never won a kendo match. He was once chosen to be a starter after a teammate was suspended for causing an uproar. Watsuki grew frustrated with kendo, and eventually quit. When he was challenged to come up with a new character for Rurouni Kenshin, he used his outlook on kendo to design Yahiko Myōjin. In high school, he won the Hop Step award for his work on the series _Podmark_. Not much is known about _Podmark_ because it has not been translated to English. 

When not working on manga, Watsuki enjoys playing video games, reading other manga, and watching television. His favorite American comic series is _X-Men_ because he likes the action. His favorite anime (other than his own) is _Neon Genesis Evangelion_. He likes video games like _Samurai Spirits_, and action movies like _Die Hard_ and _The Matrix_. 

In November 2017, Tokyo Police raided Watsuki's home as part of an investigation into the purchase of child pornography. The search uncovered DVDs containing videos of naked girls less than 18 years of age. The serialization of _Rurouni Kenshin: The Hokkaido Arc_ was put on hiatus after the details of Watsuki's charges were made public. In February 2018, Watsuki was fined ¥200,000. _The Hokkaido Arc_ resumed serialization in June 2018.

[1st Twitter](https://twitter.com/NishiiTerumi) | [2nd Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nishiiterumi1) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/teruminishii.bsky.social) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRVXG5v77o6zvzBxb9NxffQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/terumi_nishii/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=17680136) | [Website](http://studio-meiris.com/)

Initially wanting to become a mangaka, it wasn't until while studying at Osaka Designers' College that Ishii thought about becoming an animator after having seen [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), a show directed by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/). Shortly thereafter a re-telling movie for the series was announced and Nishii set her sights on being part of the production. After graduating she joined Studio Cockpit and managed to make her debut on the film as an in-betweener.

In 2011, she made her debut as a character designer on [Penguindrum](https://anilist.co/anime/10721/), another show of Ikuhara's.

__[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/yutakami)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Yuu Takami__ is a Japanese musician, composer and arranger.

__[Website](https://nmnlpop.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_23ki_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_23ki_/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpLKk1TqiGRqLWcR9_ZcNaA) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7ctyyNnO9O2dDD8bHjkCAh)__

__Introduction:__
__Tsumiki__ is a Japanese VOCALOID producer and the composer of musical duo, NOMELON NOLEMON. 

__Biography:__
He debuted in 2017 with the VOCALOID song, "Tokyo Diver Fake Show" featuring [IA](https://anilist.co/staff/124349/) and quickly became popular on NicoNico debuting at number 19 on The Weekly VOCALOID Ranking the week of its release and going up to 3rd place the following week.

On his birthday August 11th 2021, __Tsumiki__ announced the formation of his musical group [NOMELON NOLEMON](https://anilist.co/staff/342602) with [Maria Miki](https://anilist.co/staff/199397/Maria-Miki).

__[Website](https://nmnlpop.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_23ki_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_23ki_/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpLKk1TqiGRqLWcR9_ZcNaA) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7ctyyNnO9O2dDD8bHjkCAh)__

Singer/songwriter from Japan who made his debut in 2022.

__[Website](https://tatsuyakitani.com/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgP3GbgbuVzAhlctGU5yuPA)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsuyakitani)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/inunohone/)__

__Introduction:__
Tatsuya Kitani is a Japanese vocalist, bassist, guitarist, composer, arranger and programmer. He is also known as a Vocaloid song producer, going under the name Konnichiwa Tanita-san/Hello Tanita-san.

__Biography:__
Tatsuya started publishing music on the Internet around 2014. Later in 2017, he would start performing solo activities, while providing music as a lyricist. In 2018, he would form the band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163) (stylized as sajou no hana) with members Sana and [Sho Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/109345).

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

He once worked as an assistant for his favorite author Takeshi Obata, and is influenced by Marvel comics such as the X-Men and Spider-Man.

When Watsuki was a young boy, his brother, who was three years older, drew manga. Watsuki’s older brother was his role model so he started drawing Manga as well. Watsuki was also inspired by a variety of early Manga artists such as Osamu Tezuka and Fujiko F. Fujio. Later on, his brother stopped drawing manga but, "Because Mr. Watsuki was dumb, he kept drawing it (manga) for a while.” 

When Watsuki was in middle school, he practiced kendo. He still drew manga but also enjoyed sports. Watsuki admits that he was “so weak, in fact, that I was an embarrassment to my 183 centimeters of height." Watsuki never won a kendo match. He was once chosen to be a starter after a teammate was suspended for causing an uproar. Watsuki grew frustrated with kendo, and eventually quit. When he was challenged to come up with a new character for Rurouni Kenshin, he used his outlook on kendo to design Yahiko Myōjin. In high school, he won the Hop Step award for his work on the series _Podmark_. Not much is known about _Podmark_ because it has not been translated to English. 

When not working on manga, Watsuki enjoys playing video games, reading other manga, and watching television. His favorite American comic series is _X-Men_ because he likes the action. His favorite anime (other than his own) is _Neon Genesis Evangelion_. He likes video games like _Samurai Spirits_, and action movies like _Die Hard_ and _The Matrix_. 

In November 2017, Tokyo Police raided Watsuki's home as part of an investigation into the purchase of child pornography. The search uncovered DVDs containing videos of naked girls less than 18 years of age. The serialization of _Rurouni Kenshin: The Hokkaido Arc_ was put on hiatus after the details of Watsuki's charges were made public. In February 2018, Watsuki was fined ¥200,000. _The Hokkaido Arc_ resumed serialization in June 2018.
